New Records: Nepal played and missed 17 of the 36 balls (47.22%) in the first six overs, the highest for any team in a men's T20I.
Key Match Events: Max O'Dowd scored an unbeaten 54 to lead Netherlands to victory.
Tim Pringle and Logan van Beek each took three wickets to stifle Nepal's batting.
Nepal was bowled out for 106 in 19.2 overs.
Netherlands chased down the target with 8 balls to spare.
Nepal dropped crucial catches at key intervals.
Sompal Kami and Karan KC kept the bowling tight, conceding only four runs in the first 15 balls of Netherlands' innings.
A run out by Kami brought about the end of Sybrand Engelbrecht's innings.
Max O'Dowd had a huge slice of luck when Rohit Paudel dropped a straightforward chance in the 18th over.
Pre-Game Insights: Early-morning rain and overcast conditions delayed the toss by 30 minutes.
Netherlands captain Scott Edwards chose to bowl after winning the toss.
Post-Match Reflections: Max O'Dowd's experience and patience were crucial in securing the win for Netherlands.
The dropped catch by Rohit Paudel seemed to ease O'Dowd's nerves and helped Netherlands secure the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Early-morning rain and overcast conditions affected the match.
The Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas can seat 7000 but felt bigger due to the vocal Nepal fans.
Nepal's first T20 World Cup in a decade.
